did it work? i think it did. i dont even have ksp yet but i know alot about it, ive been learning everything about it.

it uses turboramjets that tilt so they can be used for vtol and regular flight.

once flying nominally it activates the 4 pulse detonation engines to get up to hypersonic speeds.

when flying supersonic it activates the 4 scramjets.

since its an ssto, it has engines for space, 1 linear aerospike and 2 ion engines, as well as a deployable solar sail.

for thiner atmosperes such as duna's, a small bay containing a single electric collapsable propeller, is activated.

it is also prepared for any emergency, like what if you need to make an emergency landing and there is no runway? that is why it is a vtol. but that same situation happens but all engines have failed? it has an inflatable balloon it can use for landing.

what about plumiting through the atmospere and the parachutes fail? it has emergency airbags like the ones curiosity used to land on mars. what if there is no land? the airbags double as a float.

it can be used in any situation.

all things mentioned are from existing mods.

I think if you can produce a small scale test vehicle you will find the stock parts can give you the desired performance and get to space on the cheap and very quickly. All you need are stock Mk. 2 parts, a nosecone and your choice of liquid fuel engine; experiment with the size and type of engine for optimal performance. 

You may not even need mods at all if stock parts can fulfill your performance expectations.

I haven't replicated a triangle hypersonic craft in 1.0.x yet but

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cQtE_1UDIwU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
.
As for landing and emergency situations, I found it was possible to soft-land the non-recoverable test version of this craft even with realistic aerodynamics (FAR) so added landing gear and used it for point to point sub-orbital flights since. A single radial stock parachute will do for the worst of cases, since with SAS it is virtually impossible to spin out a Kerbal craft with anything less than physical destruction of parts, or bad symmetry.
